title: Port pulse-remote-web to React Native
description: Small, LLM-friendly checklist to guide porting the pulse-remote-web app to React Native using the pulse-remote websocket server and REST API.

steps.step: Inspect pulse-remote-web architecture and feature set
List RN screens: sinks, sources, config, about
Map websocket actions and payload types from generated/message
Map status shape (sinks, sinkInputs, sources, buildInfo)
Set up RN navigation landing on sinks list
Build websocket client with auto-reconnect and JSON send
Create volume state store with optimistic updates and throttle
Implement sinks screen with sliders and sink-input nesting
Implement sources screen with sliders and monitor filter
Implement move sink-input between sinks interaction
Add config storage (hostname/port/endpoint, volume limits, show monitors)
Add server info view using build metadata
Handle loading, error, and empty states
Add basic theming and reusable UI primitives
Verify feature parity with web and note gaps
